description: President Joe Biden is planning to unveil proposals that could dramatically reshape the Supreme Court, including term limits on justices who now sit on the court for life, according to a person familiar with the deliberations.
title: Biden Plans to Propose Supreme Court Reforms, Including Term Limits

description: Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Whatley warned against complacency when his party concludes its official nominating jamboree this week with polls predicting ex-President Donald Trump prevailing over President Joe Biden in the November election.
title: Trump’s GOP Expands Battleground Map, Warns Against Victory Lap

description: President Joe Biden said condemnation of the assassination attempt on Donald Trump should be joined by criticism of violence against Black Americans, rejection of political extremism and support for gun control, as he returned to the campaign trail in search of a path forward for his beleaguered campaign.
title: Biden Pivots Back to Politics at NAACP After Trump Shooting

description: Russia and Ukraine were set to swap 180 prisoners in a deal facilitated by the United Arab Emirates, a person familiar with the matter said, in what will be the sixth exchange this year managed by the Gulf state.
title: Russia and Ukraine Set to Swap 180 Prisoners in UAE-Backed Deal

description: The full transcript, fact-checked.
title: Donald Trump’s Bloomberg Businessweek Interview: Complete Text

description: Bloomberg Businessweek sat down with the ex-president at Mar-a-Lago for an exclusive interview.
title: Trump on What He’d Do With Taxes, Tariffs, Jerome Powell and More

description: Business leaders don’t love all of Trump’s policies, but after several twists in the presidential campaign, he’s earning vocal support in some surprising quarters.
title: Interviewing Trump on His Plans for the US Economy

description: The ex-president on tax cuts, Taiwan, Jerome Powell and Jamie Dimon.
title: Top Takeaways From Businessweek’s Donald Trump Interview

description: Above all else, Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump’s selection of JD Vance as his running mate for the 2024 election signals how powerful populism remains in US politics. Vance, a 39-year-old freshman senator from Ohio and the author of Hillbilly Elegy, has been one of the strongest voices for Trump’s brand of politics on Capitol Hill. He’s now positioned to be the standard-bearer of Trumpism after Trump.
title: A Brief History of JD Vance and His Populist Politics

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg correspondents Mark Niquette and Erik Wasson look at how Joe Biden is facing revived Democratic dissent . Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Faces Revived Democratic Dissent as Trump Basks in GOP Unity

description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how microcredit pioneer Muhammad Yunus went from winning the Nobel Peace Prize to facing life imprisonment.
title: Why This Nobel-Winning Banker Faces Life Imprisonment in Bangladesh

description: Donald Trump’s pick of Senator JD Vance as his running mate Monday hardens the Republican party’s shift toward trade protectionism and positions a successor to entrench the viewpoint for years to come.
title: JD Vance Pick Hardens GOP Swing to Protectionist Trade Stance

description: Exiled Chinese tycoon Guo Wengui, whose crusade against the Communist Party attracted allies including Donald Trump associate Steve Bannon, was convicted for duping investors out of $1 billion to fund his luxury lifestyle.
title: Chinese Tycoon Guo Guilty in US of $1 Billion Investor Fraud

description: The State Opening of Parliament and the King's Speech will take place on Wednesday and marks the formal beginning of the first parliamentary session since the General Election.
title: What Does the State Opening of Parliament Involve and Why?

description: Venezuela’s government is ramping up dollar sales to contain inflationary effects resulting from Nicolás Maduro’s presidential campaign spending.
title: Venezuela Boosts Dollar Supply Amid Election Spending Frenzy

description: The US Secret Service increased security around former President Donald Trump after obtaining intelligence in recent weeks of an Iranian plot to assassinate him, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: US Learned of Iran Plot on Trump, No Known Link to Rally Attempt

description: European Council President Charles Michel fired back at Viktor Orban to “set the record straight” over the Hungarian premier’s freelance diplomacy with Vladimir Putin, Xi Jinping and Donald Trump.
title: EU’s Michel Hits Back at Orban Over Trump Peace Plan Letter

description: About 77 opposition supporters and aides have been arrested since Venezuela’s presidential campaign began on July 4, a Caracas-based human rights organization reported on Tuesday.
title: Venezuela Government Repression Surges Ahead of July 28 Vote

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer called Tuesday on New Jersey Democrat Bob Menendez to resign after the senator was convicted on corruption charges.
title: Schumer Calls on Menendez to Resign After Corruption Conviction

description: Angela Rayner, Britain’s new deputy prime minister, has long been expected to be a key power broker in the incoming Labour government. But Rayner’s allies say she has had a slow start in the early sprint for power in Keir Starmer’s administration.
title: Starmer’s Union-Backed No. 2 Falls Short in Early Dash for Power

description: US Senator Bob Menendez, the powerful New Jersey Democrat, was found guilty of corruption charges related to the FBI seizure of 13 gold bars, nearly $500,000 in cash and a Mercedes Benz at his home.
title: Senator Bob Menendez Convicted by Jury at Corruption Trial

description: Ghana has kicked off an initiative to bolster its small and medium-sized enterprises after a debt restructuring weighed on business growth.
title: Ghana Starts $532 Million Plan to Bolster Companies After Crisis

description: Mozambique will by the end of the month remove at least 5,000 so-called ghost workers from its payroll, according to the International Monetary Fund, which had warned the southeast African nation over its ballooning public wage bill.
title: Mozambique to Cut 5,000 Ghost Workers, IMF Says After Warning

description: European Union member states signaled support for provisional tariffs on electric vehicles shipped from China in a secret non-binding vote this week that showed the bloc’s appetite for taking on the world’s second-biggest economy over trade concerns.
title: EU Nations Signal Support for Provisional Tariffs on China EVs

description: The UK government said it’s “concerned” about the impact of electric vehicle imports and considering potential action, after the European Union moved to impose provisional tariffs on EVs imported from China.
title: UK Weighs Response After EU Imposes Tariffs on China EV Imports

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s plans to meet Brazil’s fiscal target are set to disappoint those who may be expecting structural cuts to spending.
title: Brazil’s  Lula Plans to Forgo Structural Spending Cuts Sought by Investors

description: The UK and other European states are planning to expose new examples of Russian disinformation as they pursue a more assertive response to alleged interference by the Kremlin in Western elections at a meeting of the European Political Community this week.
title: UK, EU States Plan Response to Election Interference by Russia

description: When an outraged Ukrainian lawmaker berated JD Vance at this year’s Munich Security Conference over the Republicans’ blocking of aid to his country, the US senator listened patiently. But Oleksiy Honcharenko couldn’t change his mind.
title: Trump’s VP Pick Fuels European Anxiety Over US Backing for Kyiv

description: In 2019, former President Donald Trump proclaimed he was not a fan of cryptocurrencies because their values are based on “thin air” and they can facilitate drug trafficking and other crimes.
title: Trump Seizes on Crypto as ‘Wedge Issue’ as Donors Cheer Him On

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer will flesh out Labour’s plans from border control to smoking as he sets out the new UK government’s legislative agenda for the coming Parliamentary session in a King’s Speech on Wednesday.
title: Labour to Flesh Out Planned New Laws in King’s Speech

description: Oman said six people were killed in a shooting attack on a Shiite Muslim mosque in Muscat, a rare incident of violence in the Gulf capital.
title: Rare Shooting Attack on Shiite Mosque in Oman Leaves Six Dead

description: Kenyan President William Ruto fired most of his cabinet in the wake of anti-tax protests that claimed at least 50 lives. Thousands of youths have taken to the streets of Nairobi, the capital, and other towns since mid-June to demand the withdrawal of levies on items ranging from bread and diapers to imported wheelchair tires. The demonstrations turned deadly when police used teargas, water cannons and live bullets to disperse the crowds. While Ruto initially described the agitation as treason, h
title: How Anti-Tax Protests Have Shaken Up Kenyan Politics

description: JD Vance cuts the profile of an outsider’s insider on Capitol Hill and K Street.
title: Vance Embrace of Trump’s Populism Makes Big Business Nervous

description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal said his nation had received the first 50,000 rounds of heavy ammunition as part of a Czech-led initiative.
title: Ukraine Hails Arrival of First 50,000 Rounds in Czech Initiative

description: For some it’s a worrying combination: Donald Trump back in the White House and a brash Central American president who declares himself the world’s coolest dictator.
title: Bitcoin Backer El Salvador Bonds Are a Top EM Trump Trade

description: Thai Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin ordered an urgent probe into the mysterious deaths of six foreigners at a luxury hotel in Bangkok on Tuesday, as authorities rushed to contain any fallout on the nation’s key tourism industry.
title: Thailand Probes Deaths of Foreigners in Bangkok Luxury Hotel

description: The US presidential election has seen a wave of unprecedented events, but one constant has been donor money pouring into campaign coffers.
title: Billionaires Take Sides as Turbulent Presidential Race Heats Up

description: The International Monetary Fund has upgraded its forecast for UK economic growth this year in an early boost for the new Labour government.
title: IMF Lifts UK Growth Outlook in Boost for New Labour Government

description: Kenyan police used teargas to disperse protesters in some of the nation’s biggest cities, shuttering shops and offices in their central business districts.
title: Kenya Police Tear-Gas Protesters, Halting Business in Key Cities

description: First Minister of Wales Vaughan Gething said he is resigning after four members of his government quit in protest at his handling of a row over campaign donations, in a blow to UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer and his new Labour administration.
title: Welsh Labour Leader Gething Quits in Early Blow to Starmer

description: Slovakia amended an overhaul to its criminal code, yielding to pressure from the European Commission to avoid a clash that would put crucial funding at risk.
title: Avoiding Risk to EU Funds, Slovakia Amends Criminal Overhaul

description: Roberta Metsola won another stint as president of the European Parliament Tuesday as lawmakers prepare to vote later in the week on Ursula von der Leyen’s bid for a second term as head of the European Union’s executive arm.
title: Metsola to Remain EU Parliament Head as Von der Leyen Seeks Nod

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s VP Pick Vance Could Give Europe a Jolt

description: The White House proposal would cap rent increases at 5% for millions of tenants nationwide. But Congress is unlikely to act.
title: Biden Calls for National Rent Control on Corporate Landlords

description: Vietnam is scrambling to boost state spending after the pace of budget utilization in the first-half of the year decelerated, as government officials wary of an anti-graft campaign dither over decisions.
title: Vietnam Seeks to Revive Public Spending Stunned by Graft Drive

description: Fifteen people were charged in Dublin late Monday night after violent clashes with police broke out at an anti-immigration protest in a northern suburb of the city.
title: Arrests in Dublin After Violent Anti-Immigration Protest Erupts

description: The European Commission plans to make a proposal on a package of $50 billion of loans to support Ukraine “very soon” so as to meet a year-end deadline to complete legislative work, Economy Commissioner Paolo Gentiloni said.
title: EU to Have Ukraine Loans Proposal ‘Very Soon,’ Gentiloni Says

description: South Africa’s new infrastructure minister called for a doubling of public sector investment to help fuel a construction boom in the country.
title: South Africa’s Infrastructure Minister Touts Construction Boom

description: China poses a “deadly” threat to the UK, the former NATO secretary-general appointed by Prime Minister Keir Starmer to lead a strategic review of Britain’s defense posture said.
title: China Poses Deadly Threat to UK, Starmer Defense Adviser Warns

description: Rwandan President Paul Kagame secured another five-year term after winning 99% of four-fifths of the votes counted, extending his two-and-a-half-decade rule of the East African nation.
title: Rwanda’s President Is Set to Secure Fourth Term With 99% of Vote

description: A senior North Korean diplomat based in Cuba defected to South Korea in November, becoming one of the highest-level diplomats in recent years to leave the reclusive state for its rival, a major daily reported.
title: Senior North Korean Diplomat Based in Cuba Defects to the South

description: Several European countries are considering reopening their embassies in Afghanistan in a move that would entail diplomatic recognition of the Taliban almost three years after the fall of Kabul, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Nations Mull Reopening Afghan Embassies, Recognizing Taliban

description: French President Emmanuel Macron is about to set in motion the appointment of a caretaker government until negotiations to find a new prime minister bear fruit.
title: France Readies for Caretaker Government With Exact Remit Unclear

description: UK economists are skeptical about the ability of Keir Starmer’s Labour government to turbo-charge growth, anticipating the slow expansion that blighted much of the past decade will continue, a survey showed.
title: UK Economists Doubt Labour Government’s Ability to Boost Growth

description: The sister of North Korea’s leader warned Seoul there would be “a gruesome” price to pay over anti-Pyongyang leaflets floated across the border, indicating her country may raise the stakes after sending trash-laden balloons to South Korea.
title: Kim Jong Un’s Sister Warns South Korea It Will Pay ‘Gruesome Price’ for Leaflets

description: JD Vance branded China the biggest threat to America in one of his first interviews since being named Donald Trump’s running mate, underscoring the likely hawkish stance of their administration toward Beijing if elected.
title: Trump’s VP Pick Vance Says China Is the ‘Biggest Threat’ to US

description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s spy agency said Tuesday that a North Korea diplomat based in Cuba has fled to South Korea, the latest in a series of defections by members of the North's ruling elite in recent years.
title: North Korean Diplomat in Cuba Defected to South in November, Spy Agency Confirms

description: New tariffs of 60% on all Chinese exports to the US would more than halve China’s annual growth rate, according to new research from UBS Group AG, underscoring the risks for Beijing if former President Donald Trump returns to the White House.
title: US Tariffs at 60% Would Halve China’s Growth Rate, UBS Says

description: Donald Trump’s party assailed President Joe Biden’s stewardship of the economy, hours after the Republican standard-bearer selected US Senator JD Vance as his running mate, highlighting a populist message aimed at retaking control of the White House.
title: RNC Kicks Off With Trump Allies Bashing Biden’s Handling of Economy

description: Former President Donald Trump’s choice of JD Vance as his running mate makes his break with the foreign policy old guard of his party complete.
title: Trump’s Vance Pick Widens Rift With GOP’s Foreign Policy Old Guard
